name: 4.1.6-383.v9d1dd57200e0
body:
<!-- Optional: add a release summary here -->
## 🚀 New features and improvements

* Use symbol API to theme icon (#158) @NotMyFault

## 👻 Maintenance

* Fix queue metric descriptions (#161) @Bonifacio2
* Configures project to use CD workflow (#165) @alecharp

<!-- Optional: add a release summary here -->
## 🚀 New features and improvements

* Move to jenkins-table (#150) @NotMyFault

## 👻 Maintenance

* Move away from deprecated Release Drafter App (#143) @NotMyFault
* Update plugin parent POM and BOM (#153) @basil

<!-- Optional: add a release summary here -->

## 📦 Dependency updates

* Bump bridge-method-injector from 1.21 to 1.23 (#131) @dependabot
* Bump plugin from 4.19 to 4.33 (#134) @dependabot

## Enhancement

* Use the same unit for JMX than for json (#59) @Vlatombe
* `Queue.Executable.getParentExecutable` obsoletes `RunResolver` (#126) @jglick 

## Bug fixes

* Use `ExecutorListener` to avoid excessive thread creation (#127) @jglick

## 👻 Maintenance

* Replace png icon with vector graphic (#121) @NotMyFault
* Integrate security fix from 4.0.2.8 (#133) @Wadeck
* EOL JSR 305 (#135) @basil

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jenkinsci/metrics-plugin/compare/metrics-4.0.2.7...metrics-4.1.6.1

<!-- Optional: add a release summary here -->
* Support `WorkflowRun.isDisabled` (#107) @jglick
* [JENKINS-65398](https://issues.jenkins.io/browse/JENKINS-65398) - Terminology update for metrics plugin (#98) @kerogers-cloudbees

## 📦 Dependency updates

* Bump bridge-method-injector from 1.18 to 1.21 (#104) @dependabot
* Bump plugin from 4.18 to 4.19 (#108) @dependabot
* Bump plugin from 4.1 to 4.18 (#97) @dependabot

## 👻 Maintenance

* fixed typo (#88) @jinwookh

* Plugins should use slf4j-api version from Jenkins core (#74) @dwnusbaum 
* [JENKINS-63760](https://issues.jenkins.io/browse/JENKINS-63760) - notifyQueued used (#70) @joseblas

## 👻 Maintenance

* Fix CI failure (#72) @batmat
* Upgrade to use jcasc test harness (#58) @timja
* Use HTTPS URLs in pom.xml (#57) @daniel-beck-bot
* Improvements - Replace outdated usage (#56) @darxriggs

# :bug: Bugs fixes
- Update JCasC to 1.30 and fix PCT errors (#55) @fcojfernandez 

# :memo: Documentation updates
- Fix EOF and trailing spaces (#50) @darxriggs 
- Fix metrics library link (#51) @duemir 
- Use README as source of documentation for plugin page (#53) @alecharp

- Format JMX names ([JENKINS-58169](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-58169))
- Do not export VM and System metrics on JXM ([JENKINS-57909](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-57909))
- Use proper domain for JMX elements ([JENKINS-57908](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-57908))
- Add a JCasC roundtrip test ([JENKINS-57761](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-57761))

- Incrementalify plugin version ([JENKINS-51308](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-51308))
- Support Java9+ JVM ([JENKINS-52017](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52017))
- Provide an API to report on the Queue Item metrics ([JENKINS-52141](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52141))
- Minor follow-up fix after switch to weak hash map for tracking node specific stats ([JENKINS-32868](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-32868))

- Upgrade to Metrics 4.0.2. Now requires Jenkins 2.60.3 or newer and Java 8 ([JENKINS-52061](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52061))
- Register metrics added in dynamically installed plugins ([JENKINS-52067](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52067))
- Auto-start PeriodicWork extensions when metrics plugin is dynamically installed on Jenkins < 2.129 ([JENKINS-52072](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52072))
- Queuing times of pipeline jobs are incorrectly reported ([JENKINS-52074](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52074))
- Track cumulative execution time of pipelins jobs with multiple node blocks ([JENKINS-52075](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-52075))
- Defence against NPE from Jenkins core ([JENKINS-44947](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-44947))
- Switch to a weak hash map for tracking node specific stats ([JENKINS-32868](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-32868))
- Don't run healthchecks before Jenkin startup has completed ([JENKINS-32926](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-32926))

- Adjust to new logs rotation root ([JENKINS-50291](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-50291))
- Origins field was not being saved ([JENKINS-50722](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-50722))
- Add a data bound setter for access keys to allow configuration-as-code to configure #31)
- Fix the temporary disk space health check (#33)
- Fix loading of custom health check providers from newly installed plugins ([JENKINS-44486](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-44486))
- Expose metrics via JMX

- Add classloading statistics
- Track average folder depth of jobs
- Provide history and window tracking for important JVM stats such as CPU load, memory usage and file descriptor usage
- Move the health check logs into `$JENKINS_HOME/logs`
- Fix logging level to stop sending spam to the logs every time the health checks are run
- Fix calculation of queue size to prevent false rejected executions of health checks

- Stop spamming the logs with 

> Warning: Runnable is not an instance of Future: null
- Restore backwards API binary compatibility by actually processing the `@WithBridgeMethods` annotations

- Results from health checks were lost when more than 3 requests run at the same time ([JENKINS-32695](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-32695))
- Add caching to the health check API end-points (caching can be disabled with Cache-Control: max-age=0 header) ([JENKINS-32696](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-32696))
- Improve Javadoc documentation

- Improve log line readability
- Fix typo in class name
- Make the health check results available as a Java object for downstream plugins to consume

- Switch to [Jackson2 API Plugin](https://wiki.jenkins.io/display/JENKINS/Jackson2+API+Plugin) for dependency on Jackson2 API
- [JENKINS-31054](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-31054) Generate button did not work

- Upgrade metrics library to 3.1.2
- Expose plugin versions in metrics data
- [JENKINS-28620](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-28620) NPE after upgrade to 3.0.10
- An endpoint to return status 200 if everything is OK, status 417 otherwise
- Count AbstractProjects so that MavenModuleSets are included when counting jobs.

- Add project, disabled, enabled counts
- Only `TopLevelItems` should be reported in `jenkins.job.count.*`

- There was a race condition during startup that could occasionally cause a deadlock if there was both an unfortunately timed HTTP request and another plugin was attempting to enumerate extension points before [extension points can safely be enumerated](https://javadoc.jenkins-ci.org/hudson/init/InitMilestone.html#EXTENSIONS_AUGMENTED). The metrics plugin now does not attempt to enumerate extension points until after the safe-point has been reached. (If you want to understand one case where this deadlock can occur, see [this blog post](https://www.cloudbees.com/blog/jenkins-plugin-developer-case-files-episode-1-when-extensions-bites-you-posterior))

- Expose Build successful/unstable/failed/etc metrics ([JENKINS-23933](https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-23933))
- Nicer build action reporting build times (#1)

- Enable the prefix and postfix json path manipulation options in `metricsHistory` urls
- Performance improvement to avoid the cost of sorting required when calling `Jenkins.getAllItems(Class)`
- Fix NPE when using the MetricsAccessKey.Provider and there are no manually defined access keys
- When the health checks are reporting disk space issues on the master, report the node name as (master) and not the empty string!
- Fix braindead bug in boolean logic "optimization" that resulted in the logs still being spammed with identical failing health check reports.

- Decrease log spamming (only log failing health checks above FINE level when there are changes from the last reported failing health checks)
- When logging failing health checks, include the reason for the failure.
- Fix string formatting of failing standard health checks
- Add jenkins.node.offline and jenkins.executor.free metrics (both of which could be calculated but some metrics reporting systems make such calculations more complicated and these metrics are quite useful for alerting etc.)
- Initial release
